projects.name: Unregulated bus and car parking rationalized for pedestrian and vendor safety

q1: The street plays a vital role in city's commutation and connects important landmarks such as Saheliyon ki Bari, UIT Office, Lok Kala Mandal, and Sukhadiya Circle. The site acted as an unauthorized parking place for private buses, taxis/tempos, and shopkeepers' vehicles. Numerous vehicles, hand-carts, labourers, and shoppers used to merge together on streets, creating unsafe and chaotic conditions for movement. The nearby roadways' bus stop also needs a proper channel for bus mobility. The purpose of was not only solve the current issues of this site but also inspire and encourage citizens to create similar interactive public spaces across the city.
q3: Creation of dedicated zones for parking and street vendors
Introducing traffic calming elements for pedestrian safety
Creating interactive zone for community engagement
q4: Day 1: Site cleaning and reorganizing. Demarcation of the footpath, vendor zone, and parking on site
Day 2: Junction and median demarcation with temporary traffic management elements
Day 3: Painting pop up colors in the plaza & footpath, wall paintings, and murals. Installation of street furniture and canopies
q5: Due to the current haphazard site conditions, it was difficult to document the site which was rectified with the help of smart city and municipal corporation.
q6: Yes, the city plans to scale similar placemaking interventions at busy streets and plazas, in order to create safe walkways for pedestrian movement.

members.name: Nilabh Saxena, IAS, Udaipur Smart City Limited

projects.name: Anganwadi approach street and courtyard enhanced for access and play

q1: The Anganwadi is situated at Galcha colony. It was an underutilized area with poor condition, and difficult to access. The intent is to revitalize the area, and improve access to anganwadi.
q3: -Revitalization of the area around the Anganwadi
-Painting and coloring of the exteriors
q4: Day 1: Cleaning and removal of debris
Day 2: Arrangment of reusable items to create seating elements
Day 3: Painting and beautification of the area.

projects.name: Flyover underside reclaimed for an anganwadi play and learning area

q1: The site, located in a dense neighborhood, is an abused space under the flyover. Piles of litter and haphazard encroachments had rendered the space unusable for local residents. An anganwadi is also located in the close vicinity under the flyover. The site was used for multiple activities and remained occupied by vehicular parking throughout the day. The corners and vacant pockets were used for dumping of trash and anti-social activities at night. In discussion with anganwadi workers and the community it was decided to extend the anganwadi premise for young children to play and learn.
q3: Extension of anganwadi premises to allow outdoor learning and play for young children
Creation of sandpit for free play and an amphitheatre for events for children
Painting of interactive and educational murals on flyover columns
Installation of furniture in-line with BaLA (Building as Learning Aid) concept
Creation of green pockets that will act as carbon filters
q4: Pre-execution: Collaboration with architecture and urban design studios and technical experts for design and technical feasibility. Consultation with stakeholders such as anganwadi teachers, parents, and the residents to develop a democratic design
Day 1: Clearing of site with the support of local students, volunteers, and helpers
Day 2: Finishing of mural artwork and levelling of the ground
Day 3: Fabrication and installation of railings and furniture elements
q5: Rains and thunderstorms interrupted the mobility and logistics of the resources but as the site was under the bridge it acted as a protection from the extreme rain.
q6: Yes, the city aims to identify similar spots across the city, conduct stakeholder discussions to identify issues, and execute similar solutions with the help of volunteers.
q7: - Office of the Executive Engineer, South Zone- Central Store Department

projects.name: Creating pocket garden under the flyover

q1: This site is located under the Vadsar flyover, at one of the busiest traffic junctions in the city. In its previous condition, the space has become a hub for anti-social activities. The city identified that to control this menace and provide physiological and psychological comfort to commuters, a pocket garden was the appropriate solution. The core objective was to demonstrate how micro-green spaces can impact high density traffic areas, reduce noise and air pollution, and allow people to take a breather.
q3: - Creation of a dense urban pocket park, which will act as a carbon sink and noise barrier while providing visual relief to commuters and pedestrians
- Up-cycling of hume pipes to create planters, while also minimizing on-site masonry work
- Painting of artwork on planters to add colour and vibrancy to the space
- Plantation of diverse species of flora (around 20)to demonstrate the importance of bio-diversity integration even in tight urban spaces
- Installation of seating along the edge
- Installation of intelligent water saving irrigation system
q4: Pre-planning: Sourcing waste hume pipes; studying water management and composting methods; development of design layout.
Day 1: Cleaning of site; placing hume pipes.
Day 2: Setting up irrigation system and soil filling work.
Day 3: Plantation; installation of seating and fencing.
q6: Yes. The city plans to replicate and scaled similar interventions on the already available 20+ km of flyover spaces. Plans to combine it with different stakeholders to make the spaces more multifaceted along with the greening efforts are also under consideration.
q7: - Department of Environmental Studies, Maharaja Sayajirao University of Baroda, Vadodara

members.name: Dr. Payal Desai, Department of Environmental Studies, MSU

projects.name: Underutilized intersection rationalized for parking, vending, and recreation

q1: Vijaya Chowk is a three armed junction and has a shopping mall cum multiplex on the west. A significant part of the junction was vacant that caused disorganized vending spaces, and unauthorized parking. The aim was to revamp the junction to streamline traffic and to create an active public space.
q3: - Traffic streamlining
- Creation of southern triangular passage by adding bollards
- Painting and addition of sculptures
q4: Day 1: Streamlining the movement of traffic on the western part of the junction
Day 2: Blocking of southern triangular island passage with bollards. A passage for two-wheelers was retained and the rest space was reclaimed.
Circulation streamlining by correcting geometry of traingle islands and defining the passage on the west aligned road
Day 3: Swachhata and plantation drive took place in the identified precincts. Painting of vertical and horizontal surfaces. Creation of sculptures using scrap and old/broken waste bins.

projects.name: Underutilized street section rationalized for kid play area

q1: The site is adjacent to one of the busy commercial streets connecting the surrounding residential areas. VMC wants to transform the un-utilzed grey space to utilizable for the public use. The underutilized bus stop is turning into grey area and is filled with C&D waste.
q3: - Landscape development.

- Installation of seating spaces and illuminated bollard lightings.                                                                                                  - Creation of mini kid’s play area.
q4: Day 1 - Removal of encroachments, site clearance, and basic civil works for interlocking pavers and the installation of fixtures.
Day 2 –Installation of fixtures and laying of pavement
Day 3 – Completion of landscape works installation of illuminating bollard fixtures.
q6: The city plans to replicate similar interventions across the city.
